title: Rescission of Certain Water Pressure Standards
summary: This memorandum directs the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of the Interior to rescind specific water pressure standards deemed unnecessary. The action aims to revise existing water conservation requirements in accordance with the authority granted to the President by the Constitution and federal laws. The memorandum emphasizes the need for adjustments in regulatory standards to improve efficiency in water usage without compromising conservation efforts.

title: Establishment of a National Center for Warrior Independence and Support for Veterans
summary: This executive order establishes a National Center for Warrior Independence aimed at enhancing support services for veterans. It recognizes the contributions of service members to national security and the challenges faced by veterans, both visible and invisible. The order outlines the government's commitment to addressing the needs of veterans through improved resources and opportunities for their reintegration into society. It emphasizes the importance of fulfilling obligations to those who have served in the military.

title: Memorandum on Measures to Protect the Great Lakes from Invasive Carp
summary: This memorandum outlines directives to key federal agency heads, including the Secretary of the Interior, Secretary of Commerce, Secretary of the Army, and the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency. The purpose of the memorandum is to establish and coordinate strategies aimed at preventing the spread of invasive carp species in the Great Lakes. It emphasizes the need for collaborative efforts among agencies to safeguard the ecosystem, protect native species, and ensure the health of the Great Lakes. The document details specific actions to be undertaken and the roles of various agencies in this initiative.

title: Executive Order on Improving Efficiency at the Office of the Federal Register
summary: This executive order outlines the Administration's commitment to reducing federal regulations to enhance economic prosperity. It aims to streamline processes and minimize regulatory burdens for American individuals and businesses. The order establishes initiatives to improve the efficiency of the Office of the Federal Register in its regulatory functions, thereby facilitating a more effective regulatory environment.

title: Proclamation of Military Spouse Day, 2025
summary: This proclamation recognizes the contributions and importance of military spouses to the Armed Forces and the communities they serve. It acknowledges their dedication and support, highlighting the vital role they play in the military environment. The proclamation is made in honor of Military Spouse Day, a day dedicated to celebrating these individuals.

title: Presidential Proclamation on Mother's Day 2025
summary: This proclamation recognizes and honors the significant role of mothers in families and society, acknowledging their impact on character development and nurturing future generations. It celebrates the contributions of mothers and affirms their importance to the nation's well-being on the occasion of Mother's Day in 2025.

title: Addressing Overregulation in Federal Regulations
summary: This executive order outlines the concern regarding the extensive nature of federal regulations in the United States, noting that the Code of Federal Regulations encompasses over 48,000 sections and exceeds 175,000 pages. The order emphasizes the need to reevaluate and simplify regulatory frameworks to reduce complexity and improve understanding for citizens. The initiative aims to address issues related to overcriminalization within these regulations, with the intention of making federal regulatory processes more effective and accessible.

title: Establishment of Project Homecoming
summary: This executive order outlines the establishment of Project Homecoming, which focuses on addressing issues related to immigration and its impact on various sectors such as education and healthcare in the United States. The project aims to create strategies and measures that facilitate the management and support of communities affected by significant immigration and to enhance the capacity of public services to meet the needs of residents.

title: Proclamation Commemorating the 80th Anniversary of Victory in Europe Day
summary: This proclamation issued by the President of the United States marks the 80th anniversary of Victory in Europe Day, acknowledging the conclusion of World War II in Europe and the role of the Allied Powers in this historic event. The proclamation highlights the significance of this anniversary in relation to the values of freedom and collective efforts against national socialism and fascism. It serves as a formal recognition of the historical importance and the sacrifices made during the war.

title: Presidential Proclamation for National Foster Care Month, 2025
summary: This proclamation recognizes May 2025 as National Foster Care Month. It underscores the role of families in raising children and maintaining community structures. The proclamation highlights that many children and young individuals face challenges that place them in environments lacking secure and nurturing care. It aims to bring attention to the importance of foster care and the need for safe and loving placements for these young people.
